title: Borrowed Fn closure gives "implementation of FnOnce is not general"
body:
I tried this code: [playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=99267c6aead07c71ea7208c90cafc598)

```rust
fn foo<F>(func: F)
where
    F: Fn(&str)
{
    func("sss");
}

fn main() {
    foo(|s| println!("{}",s)); // Ok
    foo(&|s| println!("{}",s)); // Error
}
```

The current output is:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error: implementation of `FnOnce` is not general enough
  --> src/main.rs:10:5
   |
10 |     foo(&|s| println!("{}",s)); // Error
   |     ^^^ implementation of `FnOnce` is not general enough
   |
   = note: closure with signature `fn(&'2 str)` must implement `FnOnce<(&'1 str,)>`, for any lifetime `'1`...
   = note: ...but it actually implements `FnOnce<(&'2 str,)>`, for some specific lifetime `'2`

error: aborting due to previous error

error: could not compile `playground`
```

This seems similar to https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/70263 but wasn't sure so I figured I'd error on the side of opening a new one.
